choices.name: Get started with research for your New Jersey ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Learn successful research strategies for New Jersey ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine records for New Jersey research.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic New Jersey research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic New Jersey Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Follow this research study for New Jersey ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step New Jersey Research, 1880-Present

  3. Ancestry: Explore resources for New Jersey research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—New Jersey Resources
    ☆ AC—New Jersey State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  4. Record Finder: Use the New Jersey Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—New Jersey Record Finder

  5. Find online and offline resources for your New Jersey research.

    ☆ FS—Tracing Your New Jersey Ancestors: Online and Offline Resources

    6. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
    4. Learn about research in colonial New Jersey.

      ☆ AC—Colonial New Jersey
      ☆ LT—Research Spotlight: Colonial New Jersey Family History Resources

    5. Follow these case studies for New Jersey research.

      ☆ LDS—Finding the parents of a New Jersey man with no vital or census records that listed his parents
      ☆ LDS—Locating the Family of an Irish Woman in Connecticut

    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in New Jersey in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for New Jersey

    2. Learn more about African American records.

      ☆ AG—New Jersey African American Records

    3. Explore the African American Gateway for New Jersey.
    4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in New Jersey in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of New Jersey


Additional Records
  1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
  4. Learn about research in colonial New Jersey.

    ☆ AC—Colonial New Jersey
    ☆ LT—Research Spotlight: Colonial New Jersey Family History Resources

  5. Follow these case studies for New Jersey research.

    ☆ LDS—Finding the parents of a New Jersey man with no vital or census records that listed his parents
    ☆ LDS—Locating the Family of an Irish Woman in Connecticut

Ethnic
  1. African American: Learn about African Americans in New Jersey in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for New Jersey

  2. Learn more about African American records.

    ☆ AG—New Jersey African American Records

  4. Native American: Learn about American Indians in New Jersey in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of New Jersey

choices.name: Learn about New Jersey archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about New Jersey archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: New Jersey Archives and Libraries
    ☆ New_Jersey State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for New Jersey.
  3. Explore theNew Jersey Dept. of Archives collection.
  4. Explore theNew Jersey State Library collection for genealogy.
  5. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for New Jersey genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  6. Search for ☆free online books on New Jersey research on the FamilySearch site.
  7. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.content:
• Explore city and county directories to find New Jersey ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about New Jersey city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: New Jersey Directories

  2. Sites: Explore New Jersey city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore New Jersey city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore New Jersey ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for New Jersey city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or New Jersey County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for New Jersey.

content.text:
Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

  1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the New Jersey Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the New_Jersey Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the New_Jersey Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the New Jersey Genealogy - Just Ask! page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. Northeast Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for New Jersey.

Regional Groups

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about New Jersey research.
  2. Explore the New Jersey research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about New Jersey research.

choices.name: Learn about New Jersey genealogy societies.

hidden.content: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in New Jersey in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: New Jersey Societies

  2. Learn about genealogy societies in New Jersey in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: New Jersey Societies

  3. Explore the Genealogical Society of New Jersey site.

  4. Explore the Central Jersey Genealogical Club site.

  5. Explore New Jersey genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  6. Get help at a family history center in New Jersey.
